content.question: To correct for positive externalities, the government should

choices.label: do nothing, since no harm is done by positive externalities
levy a tax on the output of the good or service
pay a subsidy equal to the marginal external benefit
impose a price ceiling on the good to discourage its production
impose a price floor on the good at which the marginal private benefit equals the marginal social cost

content.answer: pay a subsidy equal to the marginal external benefit

unit.text: 6: Market Failure and the Role of Government
